image.altText: People celebrate in the streets looking happy

props.synopsis: Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu denies reports his country and Hamas have agreed to a complex ceasefire deal that will see hostilities in Gaza end and hostages and prisoners released in stages. Follow live.

title.children: Israel and Hamas have reached a ceasefire agreement in Gaza, Qatari prime minister confirms

image.altText: Joe Biden, Antony Blinken and Kamala Harris delivering a speech at the White House.

props.synopsis: The deal, to halt Israel's bombardment of Gaza and free Israeli hostages and Palestinian prisoners, follows intensive negotiations in Qatar.

title.children: Biden hails 'day of success' as Israel and Hamas agree to Gaza ceasefire

image.altText: A house with its roof completely blown off.

props.synopsis: Significant damage and widespread power outages have swept the state as trees toppled powerlines, fell on homes and destroyed fences.

title.children: Sydney battered by 'biggest storm' in years, power outages across NSW

image.altText: A man in a suit with black hair looking solemn

props.synopsis: After a weeks-long game of hide and seek, South Korea's president Yoon Suk Yeol has finally emerged from the shadows. The saga has exposed the nation's political division.

title.children: After a game of hide and seek, South Korea's president emerges defiant

image.altText: A man with mud on his face in the forrest.

props.synopsis: How Australian Oscar Jenkins, a regular civilian working as a biology teacher, ended up fighting alongside seasoned commandos in the Ukrainian International Legion.

title.children: Australian teacher needed no combat experience to fight for Ukraine

image.altText: tennis player Jakub Mensik gesture to the crowd with his arms outstretched

props.synopsis: Jakub Mensik hits arguably the best shot of the tournament, Thanasi Kokkinakis proves sportsmanship is alive and Alexander Zverev is not interested in a barber. Here's the five quick hits from day four of the Australian Open.

title.children: Five quick hits: Outrageous shots, acts of sportsmanship and haircuts for 'idiots'

image.altText: Grace Stanke hard hat

props.synopsis: Dick Smith's campaign group Nuclear for Australia has paid for the American influencer to visit.

title.children: 'Just fancy hot rocks': Beauty queen aims to turn tide on nuclear

image.altText: Two men with their arms around each other

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's pick for secretary of state appears to have ended months of speculation on whether the incoming administration would back the AUKUS submarine deal, saying it will have Trump's strong support.

title.children: Trump administration will back AUKUS submarines deal, says Rubio

image.altText: Peter Dutton speaks at a press conference in brisbane

props.synopsis: Peter Dutton is well known for his "tough guy" persona,. But with teal seats in the Coalition's sights, the approach could spell trouble for the opposition leader

title.children: The clock is ticking on Peter Dutton's 'gentle giant' rebrand

image.altText: Train commuters at Parramatta Station

props.synopsis: Commuters have been told to expect crowded carriages, late services and slow journeys as industrial action affects services for a second day. Follow live updates.

title.children: Storm damage, industrial action brings Sydney trains to a crawl

image.altText: A blue image of the comet as a white trail across the screen

props.synopsis: The Sun-skirter comet C/2024 G3 is visible from the southern hemisphere this week as it makes its second-ever swing around our Sun.

title.children: How to see the rare 'Sun-skirter' comet entering our skies this week

image.altText: A close-up shot of the District Court of WA in Perth, showing signage on the building's front facade with the court's name.

props.synopsis: In a likely precedent-setting court case involving two companies, a business that received a fraudulent invoice email is ordered to pay costs to an electrical contractor who was hacked.

title.children: Scammed company ordered to fork out $190k after paying fraudulent invoice

image.altText: A man yells into a telephone headpiece while standing in front of a screen showing market information

props.synopsis: The Aussie sharemarket is likely to open higher on Thursday off the bank of strong gains on Wall St. US markets surged after record profit earnings reported by bank JPMorgan. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX to open higher after strong US bank results, TikTok prepares for shutdown

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Trump ponders exec order to halt TikTok ban

image.altText: People in the tray of a ute with balloons tied to it, with some people holding flags.

props.synopsis: A month after the December 17 earthquake struck and killed 14 people, voters are heading to the polls with the memories of recent aftershocks fresh in their minds.

title.children: 'Make Vanuatu Great Again': Pacific nation set for political showdown

image.altText: Tony Abbott at Voice committee

props.synopsis: The former PM has backed conservative Warren Mundine to run in the crucial seat over moderate Gisele Kapterian.

title.children: Abbott says teals a one-hit wonder as battle for Bradfield heats up

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: Bill Shorten Robodebt press conference

props.synopsis: NDIS Minister Bill Shorten will end 17 years in politics on Monday, sparking a cabinet reshuffle in which three ministers are set to gain.

title.children: Shorten set to leave politics nine days early

image.altText: An empty bottle of hand sanitiser on light brown first covered with small sticks

props.synopsis: Community leaders in Alice Springs say they are concerned drinking hand sanitiser has become an ongoing problem for the town's most vulnerable people. Some experts are calling for greater regulations around the sale of the product.

title.children: Alice Springs community concerned about hand sanitiser drinking trend

image.altText: A radio telescope superimposed on top of an image of a pulsar.

props.synopsis: Australian researchers have discovered a dead star that takes hours rather than milliseconds to spin, challenging scientists' understanding of how these stars form.

title.children: Rule-breaking spinning star discovered by Australian astronomers

image.altText: A woman stands in the street looking as flames and smoke billow from the windows of a home.

props.synopsis: The three-storey home at Truganina was fully alight when fire crews arrived in the early hours of this morning.

title.children: Woman dead after house fire in Melbourne's west

image.altText: A plane coming in to land at sunset, against an orange sky, taken from the ground from behind.

props.synopsis: Donald Tusk says Russia had been seeking to conduct attacks on airlines belonging to Poland and other countries.

title.children: Russia plotted 'acts of air terror', Polish PM says

image.altText: Elon Musk wears a serious expression.

props.synopsis: The US Securities and Exchange Commission is suing Elon Musk, the owner of social media site X, alleging the world's richest man held off declaring his substantial purchase of Twitter shares in 2022.

title.children: 'Totally broken organisation': Musk sued over Twitter share purchase

image.altText: A sign saying Kurweeton Road Cemetery est. 2010, surrounded by wild grass

props.synopsis: For the past 15 years, one of the world's first purpose-built upright cemeteries has offered people the unusual alternative of being buried "standing up".

title.children: Ever thought about being buried upright? Here, you can

image.altText: Three girls lying in a triangle at the beach, sunscreen bottles in the middle.

props.synopsis: As a growing number of "sun protective" make-up and beauty products hit the shelves, experts say there are a few things to keep in mind to ensure you're properly protected from the sun.

title.children: Australians warned against relying on cosmetic ‘sun balms, sun sticks’ to protect their skin

image.altText: The Hollywood sign is seen as smoke haze covers the sky

props.synopsis: The 2028 Olympic Games feels like a world away, but one expert says the city of Los Angeles will still be rebuilding by the time the mega-event comes to town.

title.children: LA fires inch towards Olympic venues but 2028 Games 'not impossible'

image.altText: Tent at beachside camping area.

props.synopsis: "Ghost camping", the practice of leaving an unoccupied tent or caravan on a campsite to reserve the spot, is again a hot topic as frustrated holiday-makers struggle to find a site at their favourite Tassie campground. So, what can Tasmania learn from other places about how to stamp out ghost campers?

title.children: Full but not occupied: Ghost camping rears its head in Tasmania

image.altText: A coles shopping centre

props.synopsis: A major supermarket has announced it will no longer sell kitchen knives after one of its employees was allegedly stabbed by a 13-year-old boy in Queensland on Monday.

title.children: Coles to stop selling knives nationwide after staff member stabbed

image.altText: A group of players huddle up during a rugby league match

props.synopsis: Wests Tigers summer optimism has turned to poison each of the last three years. Can things be different with Jarome Luai at the helm in 2025?

title.children: After three-straight wooden spoons, Wests Tigers are holding out for a hero

image.altText: A red mines rescue truck parked alongside a rocky mound with a black pulley wheel and cable on its trailer

props.synopsis: The recoveries of bodies come months after the miners, who officials say were illegally mining, were first discovered and had their food and water cut off in a bid to force them out.

title.children: South African mine rescue death toll rises amid illegal mining stand-off

image.altText: A medium sized brown dog sitting under a desk looks upwards.

props.synopsis: Reece the one-year-old kelpie had been missing for 11 days when two fishermen spotted him stranded halfway down a rocky ocean cliff on the NSW South Coast.

title.children: Lost kelpie rescued from cliff face by gutsy fishermen

image.altText: An illustration of a doctor sitting at a computer next to a patient who is living in a bigger body. They're talking.

props.synopsis: The Global Commission on Clinical Obesity has put forward 18 criteria for diagnosing clinical obesity, moving away from the use of the Body Mass Index.

title.children: Two new classes of obesity identified as medicos rethink BMI and health

image.altText: Several people sit at outdoor tables in front of a white brick building in a plaza.

props.synopsis: Weekend and public holiday surcharges are becoming commonplace for many businesses. In a cost-of-living crisis, what do consumers think, and what are the rules?

title.children: Have you ever paid a public holiday or weekend surcharge? Here are the rules

image.altText: At the end of a thrust stage, Christopher Tonkin as Siegfried and Kanen Breen as Roy pose, arms outstretched.

props.synopsis: In 2003, Roy Horn, one half of Las Vegas's highest-paid magic act, Siegfried & Roy, was mauled by a white tiger on stage. It's now the climax of a new opera.

title.children: The rise and tragic end of Siegfried & Roy is now an Australian opera
